correctness.description: The accuracy of the final answer (total sales from food items, excluding drinks) in the context of the problem statement.

completeness.description: The degree to which the solution covers all necessary steps for calculation and considers all relevant information from the data set provided.

efficiency.description: The effectiveness of the process used to extract data and perform calculations, considering the use of resources such as time and computational power.

robustness.description: The ability of the process to handle different datasets and potential data errors or anomalies.

scalability.description: The capacity of the solution to handle larger datasets or more complex queries without significant degradation in performance.

traceability.description: The ability to track the reasoning process and steps taken by the agents to ensure the solution's validity.

readability.description: The clarity and understandability of the code and explanations provided by the agents.

usability.description: How user-friendly the solution is, including the ease of running the script and understanding the output.

documentation.description: The presence and quality of documentation accompanying the solution, including comments in the script and explicit assumptions.
